A combination of internal and external factors, not intentional actions, pushed systems beyond limits, causing cancellations.

Seven tribunals lack chairpersons, and 18% of member posts are unfilled, hindering efficient case resolution despite government efforts and technological adoption.

The driver, Amrit Singh Saini, and a PWD staffer, Rashida Bibi, are among the seriously injured. Police are investigating the cause, with speed and potential driving lessons being considered. The car was reportedly travelling at excessive speed before losing control.

title: Is Devin Booker playing tonight vs Thunder? Latest injury update on Suns star

title: ‘Aishwarya and I approached court for our daughter’: Abhishek Bachchan breaks silence on HC orders protecting family’s personality rights

This led to him and Aishwarya securing their personality rights, followed by his father's. Bachchan now urges other public figures to consider similar legal steps due to AI blurring digital boundaries and potential misuse of likeness.

title: Salman moves Delhi HC seeking protection of personality rights
description: Bollywood superstar Salman Khan has moved the Delhi High Court seeking protection of his personality and publicity rights, joining a growing list of public figures, such as Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan, Kumar Sanu, Nagarjuna and Jr NTR, pushing back against the unauthorised commercial use of celebrity identity.

title: Power of contempt is not a sword to silence critics: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has overturned a Bombay High Court order sentencing a woman to jail for contempt. Justices Vikram Nath and Sandeep Mehta emphasized that mercy and forgiveness are crucial judicial principles. They stated that sincere remorse and an apology, even if qualified, should be accepted, particularly when a contemnor acknowledges their mistake and seeks atonement.

title: Market engulfed in flames in Russia's St Petersburg; several explosions heard - video
description: A devastating fire has engulfed one of St. Petersburg's major markets, with reports of explosions. The blaze, which broke out Wednesday night in the Nevsky district, has tragically claimed one life and injured two others. Thick smoke billowed over the city as the entire market complex is believed to be consumed by flames.

Kiss of deaf: What parents need to know about ‘cochlear ear kiss injury’
description: A seemingly innocent kiss on a baby's ear can cause severe, permanent hearing loss by creating a sudden pressure shift. This 'cochlear ear kiss injury' can rupture eardrums or damage delicate inner ear structures. Experts urge caregivers to avoid ear kisses, opting for forehead kisses and cuddles instead to protect a child's fragile hearing.

description: Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams faces a new scam. A supplier allegedly sold polyester dupattas as pure silk for ten years. This fraud, involving crores, comes after a previous laddu adulteration row. The TTD has ordered an Anti-Corruption Bureau probe. The dupattas are presented to donors and VIPs, making this a breach of trust and devotional sentiment.

title: H-1b visas: US Embassy's advisory to applicants - 'Will not be allowed inside if'
description: US Embassy India has warned visa applicants against attending appointments on previously scheduled dates, as interviews are being postponed due to new social media vetting rules. H-1B visa interviews, including those for dependents, are being pushed back as far as next summer, impacting foreign workers' return to the US.

title: Venus Williams & Andrea Preti net worth 2025: Career, family & business
description: Venus Williams boasts an estimated $95 million net worth in 2025, primarily from her legendary tennis career and successful fashion and design businesses. Her partner, Andrea Preti, an actor and businessman, contributes an estimated $1-2 million. Together, their combined net worth is approximately $96-97 million, reflecting their individual financial achievements.
